page.title: 01Pentland Hills Loganlea Glen
page.content: This are is part of the Pentland Hills and lies to the SW of Edinburgh. The altitudinal range is from 240-579m (Scald Law). Two blocks runSW separated by the deep and picturesque valley of the Logan and Glencorse Burns with 2 reservoirs. The valley gives the impression of a remote wilderness. All the peaks are grass or grass heath covered with the exception of black Hill which is heather. Evidence of glaciation is present and it was during Pleistocene glaciation that the valley between Back and Hare Hill ws formed by melting ice. Rainfall increses with altitude to over 1000mm annum March and April are the driest months, August and October the wettest. the sunshine record is 1300 hrs/annum. Prevailing winds are south westerly. Temperature varies inversely with altitude.
